item.title: 英国希望实现社会流动，但私立学校仍占主导地位
item.description: 根据一份有关英国社会流动性的详尽新报告，尽管企业越来越努力从更多样化的背景中招聘人才，但私立学校的校友们仍然在英国社会最有权势的职位中占据主导地位。【原文：Despite increasing corporate efforts to hire from more diverse backgrounds, private school alumni remain dominant among the most powerful positions in British society, according to a sprawling new report on social mobility in the United Kingdom.】

item.title: 网络安全公司 Netskope 据称将以每股 19 美元的价格进行 IPO
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，光速创投（Lightspeed Venture Partners）支持的网络安全公司 Netskope Inc.【原文：Netskope Inc., the cybersecurity firm backed by Lightspeed Venture Partners, priced its US initial public offering at $19 per share, the top of the marketed range, according to a person familiar with the matter, who asked not to be identified as the information isn’t public.】

item.title: Mercado Pago 收购巴西公司以扩展投资产品
item.description: MercadoLibre 的金融服务部门 Mercado Pago 已同意收购巴西证券分销商 Nikos DTVM，此举将扩大其在拉丁美洲最大经济体的投资产品供应。【原文：Mercado Pago, the financial services arm of MercadoLibre, has agreed to acquire Brazilian securities distributor Nikos DTVM, a move that will expand its offerings of investment products in Latin America’s largest economy.】

item.title: 美联储今年首次降息，美国股指期货上涨：市场综述
item.description: 美国股票指数期货在亚洲早盘交易中走高，这表明美联储降息后风险情绪重新升温。【原文：US equity-index futures advanced in early Asian trading, in a sign of renewed risk sentiment following the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate cut.】

item.title: 贝宝与谷歌建立合作关系，实现人工智能主导的商务
item.description: 贝宝控股公司（PayPal Holdings Inc.【原文：PayPal Holdings Inc. and Alphabet Inc.’s Google have forged an online-shopping partnership that will combine their respective payments and artificial intelligence tools for transactions.】

item.title: 新西兰第二季度经济萎缩超过预期
item.description: 由于失业率上升和全球不确定性抑制了需求，新西兰第二季度的经济萎缩程度远远超过了经济学家的预测。【原文：New Zealand’s economy shrank much more than economists forecast in the second quarter as rising unemployment and global uncertainty curbed demand.】

item.title: Vervent 将接管 Tricolor 的汽车贷款服务
item.description: 据一份法院文件显示，在总部位于达拉斯的次级贷款公司 Tricolor Holdings 上周申请破产清算后，Vervent Inc. 将接管 Tricolor Holdings 的消费汽车贷款组合服务，但尚待法院批准。【原文：Vervent Inc. is set to take over servicing Tricolor Holdings’ portfolio of consumer car loans after the Dallas-based subprime lender filed to liquidate through bankruptcy last week, pending court approval, according to a court filing.】

item.title: 中资银行在市场触顶之际加码 10 万亿美元债券赌注
item.description: 就在中国债券的长期牛市渐行渐远之际，中国的银行却以 2019 年以来最快的速度大量举借国债。【原文：Just as China’s long bull run for bonds is fading, the nation’s banks have loaded up on government debt at the fastest pace since 2019.】

item.title: 二手车独角兽瘦身，通过印度 IPO 筹集 10 亿美元资金
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印度一些最大的二手车在线销售商正在缩减成本，退出二级市场，为潜在的股票上市做准备，这些公司可能会筹集到超过 10 亿美元的资金。【原文：Some of India’s biggest online vendors of used cars are trimming costs and quitting secondary ventures to prepare for potential stock listings that could raise more than $1 billion combined, according to people familiar with the development.】

item.title: 人民币汇率逼近可能促使出口商抛售美元的水平
item.description: 分析师说，中国的人民币汇率正接近关键水平，这可能会刺激更多的本地公司转换其持有的美元。【原文：China’s yuan is nearing key levels that may spur more local companies to convert their dollar holdings, analysts said.】

item.title: 降息引发科技股震荡，转投低价股
item.description: 周三，在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）将新出现的劳动力市场疲软与通胀率居高不下的 "不寻常 "情况描述为 "不寻常 "的情况下，美联储宣布了人们普遍预期的降息，华尔街在高飞的科技股上获利了结，转而进入市场中更便宜的角落。【原文：Wall Street took profits in high flying technology stocks on Wednesday, rotating into cheaper corners of the market after the Federal Reserve delivered a widely expected interest rate cut under what Chair Jerome Powell described as an “unusual” situation of emerging labor-market weakness while inflation remains elevated.】

item.title: 帕兰提尔在特朗普访英之际扩大英国防务交易和投资
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，Palantir 科技公司正在加强与英国的联系，承诺在英国投资 15 亿英镑，同时赢得英国国防部的一项协议，扩大其人工智能软件的使用范围。【原文：Palantir Technologies Inc. is strengthening its UK ties, pledging to invest £1.5 billion in the country while winning a deal with the UK Ministry of Defence to expand the use of its AI software, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 通胀下行，巴西央行将利率维持在 15
item.description: 巴西央行将其关键利率维持在近二十年来的高位，并承诺将长期维持在当前水平，因为高于目标的通胀预期仅显示出初步回落的迹象。【原文：Brazil’s central bank held its key interest rate steady at a nearly two-decade high, promising to keep it at the current level for a long time as above-target inflation expectations show only initial signs of coming down.】

item.title: 英国国王查尔斯向特朗普献媚，兜售 2050 亿美元的美国投资
item.description: 英国政府正在兜售来自美国企业的总额达 1,500 亿英镑（2,050 亿美元）的投资，其中包括 50 多年来英国制造的第一架美国空军飞机。【原文：The UK government is touting investments totaling £150 billion ($205 billion) from American businesses, including a deal for the first British-built US Air Force aircraft in more than 50 years.】

item.title: 主要立法者对特朗普政府准备的 TikTok 交易持谨慎态度
item.description: 要求禁止使用社交媒体应用 TikTok 的议员们对特朗普政府准备让外部投资者收购这家中国公司在美国运营的一半股权的交易表示怀疑。【原文：Lawmakers who pressed for the ban on the social media app TikTok expressed doubts about a deal the Trump administration is preparing for outside investors to acquire a half-interest in the Chinese company’s US operations.】

item.description: 中国的网络空间监管机构已指示包括阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司在内的公司停止订购英伟达公司的 RTX Pro 6000D，这是一种用于工作站的半导体，可重新用于人工智能应用。【原文：China’s cyberspace regulator has instructed companies including Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. to halt orders for Nvidia Corp.’s RTX Pro 6000D, a semiconductor for workstations that can be repurposed for artificial-intelligence applications.】

item.title: 加州监管机构警告石油交易商正受到监视
item.description: 随着燃料供应在年底趋紧，加利福尼亚州的能源监管机构正密切关注试图操纵该州汽油市场的石油交易商。【原文：California’s energy regulator is on the lookout for oil traders trying to game the state’s gasoline market as fuel supplies tighten heading into the end of year.】

item.title: 无聊公司首席建筑师离开马斯克的隧道项目
item.description: Boring Co.的首席建筑师已经离开了埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）创办的这家隧道公司，加入了一家由包括OpenAI联合创始人萨姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）在内的投资者支持的自动运输初创公司。【原文：The Boring Co.’s lead architect has left the tunneling company founded by Elon Musk to join an autonomous transportation startup backed by investors including OpenAI co-founder Sam Altman.】

item.title: Blackstone 和 TPG 重新燃起收购医疗科技公司 Hologic 的兴趣
item.description: 据熟悉此事的人士透露，Blackstone Inc. 和 TPG Inc. 已重燃收购医疗设备制造商 Hologic Inc.【原文：Blackstone Inc. and TPG Inc. have revived their interest in acquiring medical device maker Hologic Inc., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 比索触及外汇区间上限，阿根廷央行出手干预
item.description: 阿根廷中央银行自 4 月份实施交易区间以来首次对本币市场进行干预，因为比索的疲软程度超过了交易区间。【原文：Argentina’s central bank intervened in the local currency market for the first time since it implemented a trading band in April as the peso weakened beyond that threshold.】

item.description: Nscale 是一家鲜为人知的英国数据中心公司，去年从一家加密矿机公司剥离出来，如今已成为人工智能推动的大规模数据中心热潮的前沿。【原文：Nscale, a little known British data center company that spun out of a crypto miner last year, has found itself at the forefront of a massive artificial intelligence-fueled data center boom.】

item.title: 卡什-帕特尔称 Krispy Kreme 股票买入并推动疯狂上涨
item.description: 联邦调查局（FBI）局长卡什-帕特尔（Kash Patel）在国会进行了第二天有争议的作证，几个小时后，他的证词引发了今年最不寻常的一次股票大涨。【原文：Hours into his second day of contentious testimony in Congress, Kash Patel, the FBI director, sparked one of the more unusual stock rallies of the year.】

item.title: Lyft 将在配对前告知司机乘客是否给小费、是否准时等信息
item.description: Lyft 公司正在测试一项功能，该功能将告诉司机乘客给小费的频率和准时程度，从而为司机提供更多信息，帮助他们决定哪些行程值得花费时间。【原文：Lyft Inc. is testing a feature that will tell drivers how often a rider tips and how punctual they are, providing additional information drivers can use when deciding which trips are worth their time.】

item.title: 阿根廷第二季度经济下滑，反弹乏力
item.description: 阿根廷第二季度经济与今年前三个月相比出现萎缩，而下个月对哈维尔-米莱总统来说至关重要的中期选举迫在眉睫。【原文：Argentina’s economy contracted in the second quarter compared to the first three months of the year, as next month’s crucial midterm election looms for President Javier Milei.】

item.title: DE Shaw 募集 50 亿美元，成立首个由人类运作的对冲基金
item.description: D.E. Shaw & Co.正在为一个新的对冲基金募集资金，该公司将首次放弃算法，让人类交易员发号施令。【原文：D.E. Shaw & Co. is raising money for a new hedge fund, where for the first time the firm will ditch the algorithms and let human traders call all of the shots.】

item.title: 海湾国家跟随美联储今年首次降息维持钉住汇率
item.description: 在美联储今年首次降息后，包括阿联酋和沙特阿拉伯在内的阿拉伯海湾国家的信贷需求和住房部门得到了一定程度的缓解。【原文：Arab Gulf countries including the United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia followed the Federal Reserve’s first interest rate cut this year, providing some relief when it comes to credit demand and the housing sector.】
